thread.title: Puppy farming gang who left dogs to ‘rot away’ spared jail | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Puppy farming gang who left dogs to ‘rot away’ spared jail | Daily Mail Online

author: Hannah Al-Othman For Mailonline
title: Puppy farming gang who left dogs to ‘rot away’ spared jail | Daily Mail Online
text: Puppy farming gang who left dogs to ‘rot away’ and made up to £500,000 by selling sick and dying animals are spared jail Teresa Wade, 57, has been convicted of the fraud alongside three others Victoria Montgomery, 54, her daughter Roxanne, 33, and her partner Tony Hammond, 34 also pleaded guilty Nearly 2,000 dogs listed on Pets4Homes were snapped up by new owners They were advertised as 'home-bred' but were raised on a squalid farm The sydincated were slapped with suspended sentences for fraud offences Victoria Montgomery and Wade now face a prosecution for animal cruelty Published: 21:22 GMT, 1 February 2017 | Updated: 21:25 GMT, 1 February 2017 65 shares
